english_translation: From Zayd ibn Aslam, from Ibn Umar, from Abu Dhar, elevated it regarding the Duha prayer. Narrated from him is 'Abd al-Hamid ibn Ja'far. And Musa ibn Yaqub narrated from al-Salt ibn Salim, the freed slave of Talha, or the son of Uthman ibn Ubaidullah al-Tamimi, from a freed slave of Umar, from Abdullah ibn Amr ibn al-As, from Abu al-Darda', from the Prophet ﷺ. Al-Salt said: Sulayman ibn Tha'labah al-Ansari informed me of it. And al-Sha'abi said: From Ibn Umar: The Duha prayer is an innovation, and what an innovation it is, and this is more correct. It is said: Husayn ibn Ata' ibn Yasir.

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ

english_translation: Narrated by the Basrians: Amr ibn Muhammad said: Abu Mu'awiyah narrated to us, he said: Shaybib ibn Shaybah narrated to us, from al-Hasan, from Imran ibn Husayn, who said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to Abu Husayn: Indeed if you embrace Islam, I will teach you two words that will benefit you. When Husayn embraced Islam, he said: O Messenger of Allah, teach me the two words you promised me. He said: Say: O Allah, inspire me with guidance and protect me from the evil of myself.

english_translation: Musa ibn Ismail narrated to us: Ghassan ibn al-Agharra narrated to me, he said: My uncle Ziyad al-Nahshali narrated to me, from his father Husayn ibn Aws, that he came to Madinah with his camels during the time of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ, and he said: Come near to me, and he placed his hand on his head and wiped his face and made supplication for him.
